newsitem.title: GREECE: Greek finmin cuts T-bill rates by 20 bps.
newsitem.headline: Greek finmin cuts T-bill rates by 20 bps.

text.p: Greece's finance ministry slashed its three-,six- and 12-month T-bill rates by 20 basis points to 9.8 percent, 10.1 percent and 10.9 percent effective January 30, it said in a statement.

The finance ministry will issue two-year zero coupon T-notes with a yield to maturity of 10.30 percent on January 31 and auction 300 billion drachmas of 12-month T-bills on February 3. --Dimitris Kontogiannis, Athens Newsroom +301 3311812-4
